title: A Living Handbook on Estimands
text:
Welcome
This is the website for “A Living Handbook on Estimands”. This book is intended to be a living resource designed to help the readers understand and apply the concept of estimands in clinical trials, evidence synthesis, and other quantitative research studies.
We hope to assist the researchers and consumers of health research who want to learn more about estimands. Some chapters will be intended for those with minimal background to statistics and health research. We will provide more technical discussion in other chapters, as needed.
From a selfish point of view, we decided to write this book to improve our understanding of the estimands framework as outlined in the ICH E9(R1) addendum. As more work is disseminated in this area, we aim to update the book over time to stay up-to-date in our understanding of their relevance and implications to health research.

title: A Living Handbook on Estimands
section: Structure and Navigation of This Handbook
text:
Structure and Navigation of This Handbook
Each chapter will be written to be as self-contained as possible. Each chapter will contain introductory summaries with the chapter’s intended learning objectives with 3-5 key summaries.

title: A Living Handbook on Estimands
text:
Contribution and Feedback
Feedback (hopefully constructive) and contributions are welcome.

title: 1  Introduction to Estimands
text:
1.1 Authors:
Jay JH Park, Shomoita Alam

title: 1  Introduction to Estimands
text:
1.3 Key Points of This Chapter
In this chapter, we will introduce the concept of “estimands”, “estimators”, and “estimates” before introducing the “estimands framework” outlined in the ICH E9(R1) addendum. We will establish how the ICH E9(R1) estimands framework offers a structured way to plan and operationalize our research questions for clinical research
To guide further readings for the readers, we will also provide a list of of key introductory references on estimands framework to faciliate an easy introduction to estimands and estimands framework.
The key points of this chapter are:

An “estimand” refers to a target quantity we wish to estimate with our “estimator” (i.e., statistical analysis). The results of our statistical analysis are an “estimate” of the estimand.
Estimands, estimators, and estimates have existed long before the ICH E9(R1) addendum. Even without the use of the ICH E9(R1) addendum, every statistical analysis (i.e., estimator) has a target estimand that it aims to estimate.
The ICH E9(R1) estimands framework offers a structured way to plan and operationalize our research questions.
Given that the ICH E9(R1) addendum is a regulatory document that has now veen adopted by many global regulatory agencies, the era of estimands framework has already begun (regardless of how one’s view).

title: 1  Introduction to Estimands
text:
2.1 The ICH E9(R1) Addendum
The estimands framework outlined in the ICH E9(R1) addendum aims to promote clear descriptions of treatment effects being targeted in clinical trials.@ICH_E9R1_2019 Having clarity in both the target and reported treatment effects (estimands and estimates) can facilitate more informed decisions to be made by different stakeholders. The addendum presents a structured way to plan and operationalize our research questions by defining five attributes that help define the estimands (treatment effects) of interest.
The attributes of estimands include: 1. Treatment condition

Population
Endpoint (or variable)
Intercurrent events (or post-randomization events) and strategies for the specified intercurrent events
Population-level summary

Another chapter will be dedicated to discuss these attributes in more detail.
Treatment condition …
